results.title: How to use classroom films
results.brief_description: This film introduces the basic principles necessary for an effective presentation and utilisation of a classroom film. It illustrates methods of choosing and reserving a film, pre-viewing, preparing the class, and initiating a follow-up discussion.

results.title: How to take the right risks: the manager as decision maker
results.creator_credit: Pare Lorentz Jr, BNA Communications and Ameron
results.brief_description:
Episode number 5 of Series “The Manager and the Organization”.
All decisions involve an element of risk. The issues must be carefully defined and all alternatives considered. Also if it is not an isolated incident, it is desirable to establish a policy for dealing with similar situations. Narrated by Peter Drucker.

results.title: How to supervise
results.creator_credit: Francis Gysin, National Coal Board and David Pitt
results.brief_description: Defines the responsibilities of the supervisor and reinforces the need for a civilised relationship between supervisor and trainee, by giving hints for supervisors on how they should attend to the training and safety of young entrants under their charge. Although made for the coal industry most of the ideas are generally applicable.

results.title: How to Successfully Manage Your Time
results.brief_description: Practical examples of time management for office workers and business people make this instructional program most useful. It shows the effective time management techniques “How to spend your time”, “How to organise your time”, “How to eliminate time wasters”.

results.title: How to steal a million
results.creator_credit: Fred Kohlmar, World Wide Productions and William Wyler
results.brief_description: How to steal a million is a romantic comedy caper film that re-teams star Audrey Hepburn and director William Wyler thirteen years after their classic film “Roman holiday” was made. “How to steal a million” is set among the high-end fine art world of museums, collectors, dealers and con-artists. Audrey Hepburn plays Nicole Bonnet, who’s father Charles (Hugh Griffith) specialises in art fraud, in particular ‘lost’ van Gogh masterpieces, which go on to command high prices at auction. Charles’ prized (fake) Cellini sculpture, Venus, is loaned for a public exhibition in Paris. Fearing that her father’s forgery will be discovered Nicole enlists the help of renowned art thief Simon Dermott (Peter O’Toole) to steal the sculpture. O’Toole plays the charming thief and Hepburn’s love interest with aplomb. The Paris setting and couture clothes (by Givenchy) for Hepburn make “How to steal a million” a delight to watch. Also stars Eli Wallach with a guest appearance by Charles Boyer.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Fred Kohlmar, World Wide Productions and William Wyler

results.title: How to stay alive
results.creator_credit: Alan Landsburg, ABC News (US) and Alan Landsburg Productions
results.brief_description: Warning signals of heart disease show up in eight major areas of physical health. These danger signals are dramatised by documenting the lifestyles of five apparently healthy middle-aged men who are candidates for heart attacks. Each man’s doctor prescribes a change of living pattern that will greatly reduce the risk, and the extent to which the five accept their individual lifesaving prescriptions is shown. Narrated by Robert Young.
